item.title: Matt add a quote by Karel Čapek
item.description: "It's not possible to search for God using the methods of a detective... There is no way. You can only wait till God's axe severs your roots: then you will understand that you are here only through a miracle, and you will remain fixed forever in wonderment and equilibrium." -- Karel Čapek

item.title: Matt add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Alas," said Aslan, shaking his head. "It will. Things always work according to their nature. She has won her heart's desire; she has unwearying strength and endless days like a goddess. But length of days with an evil heart is only length of misery and already she begins to know it. All get what they want; they do not always like it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Matt add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "As a man cannot lift a mountain, and as a kindly man cannot kill an infant, so a man living the Christian life cannot take part in deeds of violence. Of what value then to him are arguments about the imaginary advantages of doing what is morally impossible for him to do?" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Matt add a quote by Sinclair Lewis
item.description: "Every man is a king so long as he has someone to look down on." -- Sinclair Lewis

item.title: Matt add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The consequences of every act are included in the act itself." -- George Orwell

item.title: Matt add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "When a man don't know his own mind, Miss Shirley, ma'am, how's a poor woman going to be sure of it?" -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Matt add a quote by Matt Bondurant
item.description: "The constant assertion of masculinity is always the most obvious tell of a fake. You do not constantly assert what you know you have." -- Matt Bondurant

item.title: Matt add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "It's always possible to wake someone from sleep, but no amount of noise will wake someone who is pretending to be asleep." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Matt add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Every joy is beyond all others." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Matt add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The beasts would not think it hard if I told them to walk on their heads. It would become their delight to walk on their heads. I am His beast, and all His biddings are joys." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Matt add a quote by Lew Wallace
item.description: "Perfection is God; simplicity is perfection. The curse of curses is that men will not let truths like these alone." -- Lew Wallace

item.title: Matt add a quote by Joseph Heller
Matt add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "One who contended that a poem was nothing but black marks on white paper would be unanswerable if he addressed an audience who couldn't read. Look at it through microscopes, analyse the printer's ink and the paper, study it (in that way) as long as you like; you will never find something over and above all the products of analysis whereof you can say "This is the poem." Those who can read, however, will continue to say the poem exists." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Matt add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Matt add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Matt add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Indeed in nothing is the power of the Dark Lord more clearly shown than in the estrangement that divides all those who still oppose him." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
